Key: Oh? Did Origami go home already?

Yo! It's the nice guy, Itsuka-kun!
Still haven't gone home yet?
Why are you still here?

Isn't it obvious? I was waiting around so that
I could go on a date with you!
Come on, man! What if someone hears us?!
HAHAHA! Let them hear!

(He's a lost cause. If I spend too much time
with him, my head's gonna explode.)

Sorry, but I need to get ahold of Origami.
I don't have time for you.

Hehe. Too bad, Itsuka. I just saw Tobiichi
walk past the front gate.
What?

(I wonder if I can make it in time! Or, should
I just give up?)

Hey, Itsuka. Who you gonna choose?
Your friend, or a girl?

Tonomachi, I know damn well that I won't
choose you! Later!

Hey, damn it! You're gonna leave your friend
hanging like that?! You cruel bastard! You
monster!

(Oh no. She's gone! Man, I didn't make it on
time.)
(Hm?! Is that her over there...?)
Hey Origami!
...Shido?
I-I'm so glad I caught up with you!
What's the matter?

Oh well, um... I was hoping y-you and I c-could
go on a date together?
I wouldn't mind.
I-I see. That's good. Um, so where should I go?
...Come with me.
Huh? O-Oh, okay.
Come in.
Th-Thanks...

HEY! W-WAIT! Wh-Why are you taking your
uniform off?!

Huh...? I'm home, so I'm changing. Am I
not allowed?

Oh, you can. Sorry, I misunderstood. B-But
I'd appreciate it if you did so in another
room.
Got it.

(I couldn't help but react when she started
taking her clothes off. Almost like I was in
danger...)
U-Uh, what do you want to do?
Anything you want to do, Shido.
Huh?

I can do anything you wish, Shido.
Whether it's... embarrassing or painful.
W-Well...
Tell me, Shido.
H-Huh?
Order me.
O-Order you?!
Tell me... everything you want me to do. Hurry.
....Oooooookay! I-I will! I'll say it!
U... Uh... S-Study! That's right! Let's study!
...Okay.

(Aah. It's not just in my head. I wonder if it's
because I lack concentration, or if it's because
I'm curious about Origami.)

(Alone with Origami in her room. The door's
locked shut, so I can't hear anything from the
outside.)
(All I can hear is Origami writing away.)

(It's amazing how, when it comes to studying,
Origami can flip a switch and remain focused.)
Hey, Origami! Excuse me!
I don't mind. I'm studying.
S-Sorry.
Oh, Shido-kun?!
Huh...?
It sounds like there's weak signal wherever\nyou are. I used the Yggdra Folium.
(Th-That's right! I was in Origami's room.)
S-Sorry. I'm in kind of an unusual place.
It's fine. I was just surprised we couldn't\nget ahold of you. As long as you're safe, Shido-kun,\nit's all right. How are you feeling today?

How am I feeling? Well, I'm studying with
Origami right now.
Origami...? Oh, the girl from the AST who went\nat it with the commander, right?
Y-Yes.
Ah, I'm so jealous! I hope one day she can\ngive me a hard punch, too!
O-Okay...
So how's the studying going?\nIntense, I presume?

I-It's not intense. Well, Origami's just really
focused on her studies. I can't get much done.
Yes, I understand. A normal reaction from\nspending time with someone so dedicated,\nI bet.

I-It's true that I'm interested in her, but
it's not as intense as you think.
Oh, how troublesome. If we had any data\nabout her preferences, then I could have\nassisted you.
Hm, how's this. I will give you two pieces\nof advice.
Oh... I'm fine, thanks!
Now, don't be like that. I've had my fair\nshare of experiences in the past—

N-No! Kannazuki-san, I appreciate the gesture,
but I'll figure it out. Sorry!
Wait, Shido-kun! But I'm confident—

(Phew. Sorry, Kannazuki-san, but if I took your
advice, I feel like something terrible would
happen.)
(He's kind, but a little off.)
Shido, you okay?
O-Oh. Sorry, just finished.

I see, but it surprises me to hear that you were
able to communicate with someone here".
Who were you talking to?"
W-Well, um...

If you don't want to tell me, you don't have to.
You can tell me someday. That's all.
I-I see... Sorry.
Oh... You're amazing, Origami.
Huh...?

When I asked if we could study, you immediately
switched gears, you know? I've never seen anyone
tune out outside interference like that before.

It takes me so much time to get my focus
together.

When studying for tests, I find short bursts
of concentration to be more effective. You
shouldn't have to waste your time.

Wow... I guess you're valedictorian for
a reason.
If you can adopt this habit, anyone can.

I see, but the stuff we learn doesn't even
matter in the real world. Even in short bursts,
it's hard for me to focus.

Shido, are you aware of the English word,
school"? Do you know its etymology?"
Never heard of it.

It is said to be derived from the Greek word,
scholeio". It means leisure."

L-Leisure...? That's the last thing I would've
expected when thinking of school!

In ancient Greece, the number of slaves was
double to the average citizen, which meant
students were relieved of manual labor.

Essentially, they were afforded the luxury
of time. With this remaining time, people
elevated themselves with education.
O-Oh, guess I see the connection.

If you go by the original definition, the act of
learning, however you may perceive its meaning,
is a freedom you've been given.

U-Uh. That's a lot to unpack. So are you saying
that schooling was the only method people
had to elevate themselves?

Yes. However, if you attend school and improve
yourself, you grow closer to achieving your
dreams. Think of it that way.

That's why I don't feel like anything I'm
doing now is a waste of time.
I see... Origami, you inspire me.
Huh...?

I knew you were a top student, but I always
just figured you to be a genius! Hahaha, it's
just funny, I guess.
Huh? What about that is funny?

That's not what I mean. I don't know how
to explain it, but... it was educational.
I see. If you say so, then I'm happy to hear it.

(What? R-Really? She doesn't look too happy
to me.)

(Come to think of it, I don't think I've ever
seen Origami smile.)
(...Yeah, I haven't.)

(I wonder if Origami can't express feelings
like laughter normally because her parents
were murdered by Spirits.)

(But seeing Origami let her guard down
every now and then is always nice.)

(I get it, but if she couldn't bring herself
to smile again, then that would make for
a sad life.)

(I wish that I could see Origami smile
one day. Hopefully I can share a laugh
with her, too.)

(But... I wonder if I could ever make that
happen. I mean, as Kotori says, I'm pretty
dense.)

(Well, I'm not too confident, but I want to try!
Yeah, I'll get a bright smile out of Origami!)

Shido, don't stare at me like that. You'll
make me blush.
Huh? W-Were you blushing just now?
Mm...
Hm. I don't think that day will ever come.
Huh...?
